body.p:
Head-Quarters Department of Kentucky,
Louisville, Kentucky, July 26th 1865.
Colonel

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter bearing date July 26th and in reply have to inform you that the 119. 123. 124. 125 U. S. Col'd Infantry Regts, 4th 12th & 13th Heavy Artillery, 5th & 6th Cold Cavry Regts now serving in the Dept of Ky are being enrolled with a view to ascertain the number of women and children freed under the law of March 3rd 1865 and of ascertaining correctly who was the owner of each black soldier before his enlistment. I will not be able to enroll the 107. 108. 109. 114. 115. 116. 117. 118. 122 Infantry Regt's & 8th Hy Artillery as these Regiments are not serving in this Dept. I would advise that the Governor send out at once a proper person to enroll these Regiments. It is of the greatest importance to former owner of slaves, as well as to the families and children of the Soldiers that the enrollment of them be made as it is the only correct history of the men that can be obtained

By addressing a letter to the Adjutant General of the Army, Genl Lindsey can ascertain when all Kentucky Colored Regiments, not in this Dept are now serving.
(over)

Very Respectfully
Your obd't Servt
Jas S. Brisbin
Brig Genl & Supt O. U, S, T.

Col. J. P. Flint
State Agent of Ky
